text: Is there or planning on implementing something like “sticky post” in the HubSpot Blog? A post that regardless the publish date, will show up 1st in the listing view
Had some http/https issues lately and I just contacted HubSpot and they fixed it
You can do that by having a "featured" module on the post and then referencing it above your blog loop.
“featured” module or tag?
Any tip on where I could find info on how to do this? :slightly_smiling_face: Thank you !
you could do either actually
Nope, but <@UAWETT96E> and I could work on a tutorial
I am down with that! #TutorialTime
:heart: yes! That would be awesome. I have been wanting to pin my "Definitive guides to....." for a long time
ah I see, just a module with a boolean? that might be more intuitive than adding a tag for a writer. I like it
Hello, does anyone know if it’s possible to use the language glossary term/variables in javascript?
I submitted a ticket to them yesterday as well and haven't heard back, did they know what your issue was and did you call them?

how are we suppose to insert FontAwesome icons into code again?

I'm doing the following but it's acting a bit wonky.
`<i class="{% icon name="{{ item.fontawesome_icon.name }}" style="{{ item.fontawesome_icon.type }}" unicode="{{ item.fontawesome_icon.unicode }}" %}"></i>`

*Specifically using the new Icon picker
whoa... hold up.  There's a new icon picker???
<@U54TVT3C1> <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/now-live-icon-fields-added-to-the-new-design-manager>
There just isn't any documentation really around it from what I can not find.
And it uses FontAwesome 5
Wow, <@U26C29XPH> very cool.  Hopefully some dox will show up soon
does anyone use anything for scrollspy other than bootsrap? I am looking to lighten up some code
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/FBDKXE079/image.png|hmmmm>
So, I've got a border and a triangle notch. anyone got an idea on a direction to take?
implement the triangle notch as a css triangle added as a before on the box.
that is what I was thinking. dev says not working as before, I'm sure that it is user error so i'll check it out later
Use two triangles. A blue one and a white one.
tbh, I'd probably export a SVG and position as a :before pseudo, position: absolute; top: 0 width: 100%
then just border on all other sides
could throw a div inside with a white background, put a border on two sides, rotate it 45 degrees and absolutely position it.
The CSS is 6 -10 lines of css ~40b
